messages.subject: Re: Soten Link
messages.msgSnippet: Apparently that is the work of the student Kanenori mentioned by Torigoye.  It s definately over the top.  I think I ll stick with Owari sukashi or a good
messages.messageBody:
Apparently that is the work of the student Kanenori mentioned by
Torigoye. It's definately over the top. I think I'll stick with
Owari sukashi or a good Yamakichibei.

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Soten Link
messages.msgSnippet: It seems rather atypical of a Soten work. I was rather more interesting in the write up, particularly the fact that almost 95 per cent of Soten pieces are
messages.messageBody:
It seems rather atypical of a Soten work. I was rather more interesting in
the write up, particularly the fact that almost 95 per cent of Soten pieces
are Yokohama-mono. I think the collecting public in the States needs to
realize just how much poor quality Yokohama export stuff in terms of
fittings and swords is floating around. A lot of it is very flashing
looking, but no depth of workmanship or artistic level. A lot of newbies get
sucked into buying this stuff for far more than it is worth.



Gordon



-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Richard Turner
Sent: Saturday, October 14, 2006 8:27 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Soten Link



Yeah, I saw it a while back, the work is amazing, still not a fan but
you have to appreciate the art

messages.subject: Soten Link
messages.msgSnippet: You should check this out as it s Juyo Tosogu Soten, Kaneishi Nomura Kanenori / Goshu Hikone Ju Kyoho Roku nen Chushu http://www.ryumado.com/ click the kodogu
messages.messageBody:
You should check this out as it's Juyo Tosogu Soten, Kaneishi Nomura
Kanenori / Goshu Hikone Ju Kyoho Roku nen Chushu


http://www.ryumado.com/

click the kodogu link then scroll down.
